page.title: 01AVON VALLEY S. OF AMESBURY
page.content: Much of the area is covered by rich well cultivated farm land. Many old hedgerows, hilltop tree clumps and roadside woods in the valley rmain. With the exception of gardens all the land is owned by large farms or estates. It was striking, in covering the area, how little access there was anywhere to the public. Even access to take the accompanying photographs was only very cautiously granted. Nowhere in the area did I find access to either bank of the river. A private area, a private shooting and fishing area with a little fox hunting and recently formed a very few small craft trades. Most of the houses are large older but very well kept desireable and expensive suppies and services come by private transport from Amesbury or Salisbury. Everywhere looks wealthy, is clean and well kept
